newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Creative shares rally to three-year high.
newsitem.headline: Creative shares rally to three-year high.

text.p: Share prices of multimedia company Creative Technology rallied on Thursday, close to its three-high seen back in late July 1994.
Dealers said its share price was reflecting strong gains in U.S. technology stocks.
At 0140 GMT, the stock was trading around Singapore $33.10 (US$22.83) on more than 120,000 units. It brushed an early high of S$33.20.
In the U.S., the shares closed US$1-1/8 higher on Nasdaq to end at US$22-7/8 on Wednesday, with over 2.4 million shares.
Analysts told Reuters they had revised Creative's earnings prospects upwards after it posted a strong set of third quarter results.
They expected Creative to continue to perform well in line with the company's forecast that gross margins would remain at a healthy 30-percent for the next five quarters.

According to the Edinburg Publishing's Estimate Directory, Creative was expected to record net profit of US$167.7 million for the financial year ended June 1997 against a loss of US$37.6 million last year.
